text: Emanoil-George Reicher (born 27 March 1930), is a Romanian chess FIDE Master (FM) and an International Arbiter. ==Biography== From the late 1960s to the early 1970s Emanoil-George Reicher was one of the leading Romanian chess players. He was a multiple participant in the Romanian Chess Championships, several major international chess tournaments and World Senior Chess Championships. Emanoil-George Reicher played for Romania in the Chess Olympiads: * In 1970, at second reserve board in the 19th Chess Olympiad in Siegen (+2, =3, -1). Emanoil-George Reicher played for Romania in the European Team Chess Championship preliminaries: * In 1961, at second board in the 2nd European Team Chess Championship preliminaries (+0, =2, -2), * In 1965, at fifth board in the 3rd European Team Chess Championship preliminaries (+0, =4, -2). ==References== ==External links== * *Emanoil-George Reicher chess games at 365chess.com Category:1930 births Category:Living people Category:Chess FIDE Masters Category:Romanian chess players Category:Chess Olympiad competitors Category:Chess arbiters
title: Emanoil-George Reicher
